titles.title: To designate the United States Courthouse located at 301 West Main Street in Benton, Illinois, as the "James L. Foreman United States Courthouse".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-225.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 79.

action.text: Mr. Duncan moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works by unanimous consent.

bill.summary: 4/30/1997--Introduced. Designates the U.S. Courthouse at 301 West Main Street, Benton, Illinois, as the James L. Foreman United States Courthouse.
